speaker: AJAX
text: Thersites!

speaker: THERSITES
text: Agamemnon—how if he had boils, full, all

speaker: THERSITES
text: over, generally?

speaker: AJAX
text: Thersites!

speaker: THERSITES
text: And those boils did run? Say so. Did not the

speaker: THERSITES
text: general run, then? Were not that a botchy core?

speaker: AJAX
text: Dog!

speaker: THERSITES
text: Then there would come some matter

speaker: THERSITES
text: from him. I see none now.

speaker: AJAX
text: Thou bitchwolf’s son, canst thou not hear? Feel,

speaker: AJAX
text: then.

speaker: THERSITES
text: The plague of Greece upon thee, thou mongrel

speaker: THERSITES
text: beef-witted lord!

speaker: AJAX
text: Speak, then, thou unsalted leaven, speak. I will

speaker: AJAX
text: beat thee into handsomeness.

speaker: THERSITES
text: I shall sooner rail thee into wit and holiness,

speaker: THERSITES
text: but I think thy horse will sooner con an oration

speaker: THERSITES
text: than thou learn a prayer without book. Thou canst

speaker: THERSITES
text: strike, canst thou? A red murrain o’ thy jade’s tricks.

speaker: AJAX
text: Toadstool, learn me the proclamation.

speaker: THERSITES
text: Dost thou think I have no sense, thou strikest

speaker: THERSITES
text: me thus?

speaker: AJAX
text: The proclamation!

speaker: THERSITES
text: Thou art proclaimed a fool, I think.

speaker: AJAX
text: Do not, porpentine, do not. My fingers itch.

speaker: THERSITES
text: I would thou didst itch from head to foot,

speaker: THERSITES
text: and I had the scratching of thee; I would make

speaker: THERSITES
text: thee the loathsomest scab in Greece. When thou

speaker: THERSITES
text: art forth in the incursions, thou strikest as slow as

speaker: THERSITES
text: another.

speaker: AJAX
text: I say, the proclamation!

speaker: THERSITES
text: Thou grumblest and railest every hour on

speaker: THERSITES
text: Achilles, and thou art as full of envy at his greatness

speaker: THERSITES
text: as Cerberus is at Proserpina’s beauty, ay, that

speaker: THERSITES
text: thou bark’st at him.

speaker: AJAX
text: Mistress Thersites!

speaker: THERSITES
text: Thou shouldst strike him—

speaker: AJAX
text: Cobloaf!

speaker: THERSITES
text: He would pound thee into shivers with his

speaker: THERSITES
text: fist as a sailor breaks a biscuit.

speaker: AJAX
text: You whoreson cur!

speaker: THERSITES
text: Do, do.

speaker: AJAX
text: Thou stool for a witch!

speaker: THERSITES
text: Ay, do, do, thou sodden-witted lord. Thou

speaker: THERSITES
text: hast no more brain than I have in mine elbows; an

speaker: THERSITES
text: asinego may tutor thee, thou scurvy-valiant ass.

speaker: THERSITES
text: Thou art here but to thrash Trojans, and thou art

speaker: THERSITES
text: bought and sold among those of any wit, like a

speaker: THERSITES
text: barbarian slave. If thou use to beat me, I will begin

speaker: THERSITES
text: at thy heel and tell what thou art by inches, thou

speaker: THERSITES
text: thing of no bowels, thou.

speaker: AJAX
text: You dog!

speaker: THERSITES
text: You scurvy lord!

speaker: AJAX
text: You cur!

speaker: THERSITES
text: Mars his idiot! Do, rudeness, do, camel, do,

speaker: THERSITES
text: do.

speaker: ACHILLES
text: Why, how now, Ajax? Wherefore do you

speaker: ACHILLES
text: thus?—How now, Thersites? What’s the matter,

speaker: ACHILLES
text: man?

speaker: THERSITES
text: You see him there, do you?

speaker: ACHILLES
text: Ay, what’s the matter?

speaker: THERSITES
text: Nay, look upon him.

speaker: ACHILLES
text: So I do. What’s the matter?

speaker: THERSITES
text: Nay, but regard him well.

speaker: ACHILLES
text: Well, why, so I do.

speaker: THERSITES
text: But yet you look not well upon him, for

speaker: THERSITES
text: whosomever you take him to be, he is Ajax.

speaker: ACHILLES
text: I know that, fool.

speaker: THERSITES
text: Ay, but that fool knows not himself.

speaker: AJAX
text: Therefore I beat thee.

speaker: THERSITES
text: Lo, lo, lo, lo, what modicums of wit he utters!

speaker: THERSITES
text: His evasions have ears thus long. I have

speaker: THERSITES
text: bobbed his brain more than he has beat my bones.

speaker: THERSITES
text: I will buy nine sparrows for a penny, and his pia

speaker: THERSITES
text: mater is not worth the ninth part of a sparrow.

speaker: THERSITES
text: This lord, Achilles—Ajax, who wears his wit in his

speaker: THERSITES
text: belly, and his guts in his head—I’ll tell you what I

speaker: THERSITES
text: say of him.

speaker: ACHILLES
text: What?

speaker: THERSITES
text: I say, this Ajax—

speaker: ACHILLES
text: Nay, good Ajax.

speaker: THERSITES
text: Has not so much wit—

speaker: ACHILLES
text: Nay, I must hold you.

speaker: THERSITES
text: As will stop the eye of Helen’s needle, for

speaker: THERSITES
text: whom he comes to fight.

speaker: ACHILLES
text: Peace, fool!

speaker: THERSITES
text: I would have peace and quietness, but the

speaker: THERSITES
text: fool will not—he there, that he. Look you there.

speaker: AJAX
text: O, thou damned cur, I shall—

speaker: ACHILLES
text: Will you set your wit to a fool’s?

speaker: THERSITES
text: No, I warrant you. The fool’s will shame it.

speaker: PATROCLUS
text: Good words, Thersites.

speaker: ACHILLES
text: What’s the quarrel?

speaker: AJAX
text: I bade the vile owl go learn me the tenor of the

speaker: AJAX
text: proclamation, and he rails upon me.

speaker: THERSITES
text: I serve thee not.

speaker: AJAX
text: Well, go to, go to.

speaker: THERSITES
text: I serve here voluntary.

speaker: ACHILLES
text: Your last service was suff’rance; ’twas not

speaker: ACHILLES
text: voluntary. No man is beaten voluntary. Ajax was

speaker: ACHILLES
text: here the voluntary, and you as under an impress.

speaker: THERSITES
text: E’en so. A great deal of your wit, too, lies in

speaker: THERSITES
text: your sinews, or else there be liars. Hector shall

speaker: THERSITES
text: have a great catch an he knock out either of

speaker: THERSITES
text: your brains; he were as good crack a fusty nut with

speaker: THERSITES
text: no kernel.

speaker: ACHILLES
text: What, with me too, Thersites?

speaker: THERSITES
text: There’s Ulysses and old Nestor—whose wit

speaker: THERSITES
text: was moldy ere your grandsires had nails on

speaker: THERSITES
text: their toes—yoke you like draft-oxen and make

speaker: THERSITES
text: you plow up the wars.

speaker: ACHILLES
text: What? What?

speaker: THERSITES
text: Yes, good sooth. To, Achilles! To, Ajax! To—

speaker: AJAX
text: I shall cut out your tongue.

speaker: THERSITES
text: ’Tis no matter. I shall speak as much as

speaker: THERSITES
text: thou afterwards.

speaker: PATROCLUS
text: No more words, Thersites. Peace.

speaker: THERSITES
text: I will hold my peace when Achilles’ brach

speaker: THERSITES
text: bids me, shall I?

speaker: ACHILLES
text: There’s for you, Patroclus.

speaker: THERSITES
text: I will see you hanged like clodpolls ere I

speaker: THERSITES
text: come any more to your tents. I will keep where

speaker: THERSITES
text: there is wit stirring and leave the faction of fools.

speaker: PATROCLUS
text:
A
               
              good
               
              riddance
              .

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
Marry
              ,
               
              this
              ,
               
              sir
              ,
               
              is
               
              proclaimed
               
              through
               
              all
               
              our
               
              host
              :

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
That
               
              Hector
              ,
               
              by
               
              the
               
              fifth
               
              hour
               
              of
               
              the
               
              sun
              ,

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
Will
               
              with
               
              a
               
              trumpet
               
              ’twixt
               
              our
               
              tents
               
              and
               
              Troy

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
Tomorrow
               
              morning
               
              call
               
              some
               
              knight
               
              to
               
              arms

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
That
               
              hath
               
              a
               
              stomach
              ,
               
              and
               
              such
               
              a
               
              one
               
              that
               
              dare

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
Maintain
              —
              I
               
              know
               
              not
               
              what
              ;
               
              ’tis
               
              trash
              .
               
              Farewell
              .

speaker: AJAX
text:
Farewell
              .
               
              Who
               
              shall
               
              answer
               
              him
              ?

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
I
               
              know
               
              not
              .
               
              ’Tis
               
              put
               
              to
               
              lott’ry
              .
               
              Otherwise
              ,

speaker: ACHILLES
text:
He
               
              knew
               
              his
               
              man
              .

speaker: AJAX
text: O, meaning you? I will go learn more of it.
